New Records: Jamal Musiala equalled Georgia's Georges Mikautadze as Euro 2024 top-scorer with three goals.
Germany recorded their first major tournament knockout win for eight years after being eliminated in the group stage at the last two World Cups and in the Euro 2020 last 16.
Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored a penalty in the 53rd minute.
Jamal Musiala scored in the 68th minute.
The game was suspended for 20 minutes in the first half due to a thunderstorm.
Joachim Andersen had a close-range finish disallowed for offside.
Nico Schlotterbeck had a goal ruled out for a foul in the build-up.
Christian Eriksen almost scored from a counter-attack before the match was suspended.
Havertz's header was brilliantly saved by Schmeichel.
Andersen's goal was ruled out by VAR.
VAR flagged a handball by Andersen leading to Havertz's penalty.
Florian Wirtz had a late effort ruled out for offside.
Schmeichel made a fine save to deny Havertz from close range.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany defender and player of the match Antonio Rüdiger told German television station ZDF, 'It feels really good. I think everybody who watched the match will be of the opinion that we were dominant from the start. The only criticism you can have is that we missed too many chances.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at SIGNAL IDUNA PARK in Dortmund, Germany.
